name: GoogleCloudPubSub
description: Manage PubSub topics, subscriptions and messages
helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://github.com/nexsolab/azure-devops-google-cloud-tools#readme) or [see the Cloud PubSub documentation](https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/reference/rest/v1/projects.topics)
author: Gabriel Anderson

inputs.name: authenticationMethod
inputs.label: Authentication method
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Authorization requires the following Google IAM roles:
`roles/dns.admin`

inputs.name: SCserviceAccount
inputs.label: Google Cloud Service Account
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Service Account that should be used for the next steps

inputs.name: jsonCredentials
inputs.label: JSON Credentials file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the JSON file with the credentials, see for more information

inputs.name: topicName
inputs.label: Topic name
inputs.helpMarkDown: [See the resource name rules.](https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/admin#resource_names)
inputs.visibleRule: operation != unsubscribe && operation != pause && operation != pull

inputs.name: topicKmsKey
inputs.label: KMS Key name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The resource name of the Cloud KMS CryptoKey to be used to protect access to messages published on this topic.
The expected format is projects/{project}/locations/{location}/keyRings/{keyRing}/cryptoKeys/{cryptoKey}.

inputs.name: topicPersistenceRegions
inputs.label: Allowed Persistence Regions (comma-separated)
inputs.helpMarkDown: A list of IDs of GCP regions where messages that are published to the topic may be persisted in storage. Messages published by publishers running in non-allowed GCP regions (or running outside of GCP altogether) will be routed for storage in one of the allowed regions. An empty list means that no regions are allowed, and is not a valid configuration.

inputs.name: messageData
inputs.label: Message to be queued to the topic

inputs.name: messageAttributes
inputs.label: Message attributes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Attributes for this message. This can be used to filter messages on the subscription.

inputs.name: gcpLabels
inputs.label: Resource labels
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Put JSON or use the editor.
**Keys** must start with a lowercase character and contain only hyphens (\-), underscores (\_), lowercase characters, and numbers.
**Values** must contain only hyphens (\-), underscores (\_), lowercase characters, and numbers.

inputs.name: subName
inputs.label: Subscription name
inputs.visibleRule: operation = subscribe || operation = unsubscribe || operation = pause || operation = pull
inputs.helpMarkDown: [Resource name rules](https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/admin#resource_names)

inputs.name: subAckDeadlineSeconds
inputs.label: Seconds to wait for the subscriber to acknowledge (10 - 600)
inputs.helpMarkDown: [Learn more](https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/reference/rest/v1/projects.subscriptions#resource:-subscription)

inputs.name: subMessageOrdering
inputs.label: Enable message ordering
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, messages published with the same `orderingKey` in PubsubMessage will be delivered to the subscribers in the order in which they are received by the Pub/Sub system. Otherwise, they may be delivered in any order.

inputs.name: subVpcSC
inputs.label: This project is protected by VPC Service Controls
inputs.helpMarkDown: [VPC Service Controls](https://cloud.google.com/vpc-service-controls)

inputs.name: subFilter
inputs.label: An expression written in the Pub/Sub filter language.
inputs.helpMarkDown:
An expression written in the Pub/Sub [filter language](https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/filtering).
If non-empty, then only PubsubMessages whose `attributes` field matches the filter are delivered on this subscription.
If empty, then no messages are filtered out.

inputs.name: subMechanism
inputs.label: Mechanism for message delivery
inputs.helpMarkDown: Auto value will show you more fields and the task try to help you and will choose the best option. [Learn more](https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/subscriber)

inputs.name: subAutoLargeVolume
inputs.label: Large volume of messages (many more than 1/second)

inputs.name: subAutoThroughput
inputs.label: Efficiency and throughput of message processing is critical

inputs.name: subAutoMultiple
inputs.label: Multiple topics that must be processed by the same webhook

inputs.name: subAutoServerless
inputs.label: App Engine Standard and Cloud Functions subscribers

inputs.name: subAutoPublic
inputs.label: Whether the resource can be accessed publicly or an environment where credentials are not feasible to set up

options.push: Public HTTPS endpoint, with non-self-signed SSL certificate

options.pull: The subscriber client controls the rate of delivery
options.push: The Pub/Sub server automatically implements flow control

inputs.name: subPushEndpoint
inputs.label: Enpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: A URL locating the endpoint to which messages should be pushed. For example, a Webhook endpoint might use **https://example.com/push.**

inputs.name: subPushAuth
inputs.label: Use Authorization
inputs.helpMarkDown: If specified, Pub/Sub will generate and attach an OIDC JWT token as an Authorization header in the HTTP request for every pushed message.

inputs.name: subPushServiceAccountEmail
inputs.label: Service Account Email
inputs.helpMarkDown: Service account email to be used for generating the OIDC token. The caller (for `subscriptions.create`, `subscriptions.patch`, and `subscriptions.modifyPushConfig` RPCs) must have the `iam.serviceAccounts.actAs` permission for the service account.

inputs.name: subPushAudience
inputs.label: Audience
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Audience to be used when generating OIDC token. The audience claim identifies the recipients that the JWT is intended for. The audience value is a single case-sensitive string. Having multiple values (array) for the audience field is not supported.
Note: if not specified, the Push endpoint URL will be used.

inputs.name: subPushAttributes
inputs.label: Attributes
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Endpoint configuration attributes that can be used to control different aspects of the message delivery.
The only currently supported attribute is x-goog-version, which you can use to change the format of the pushed message. This attribute indicates the version of the data expected by the endpoint. This controls the shape of the pushed message (i.e., its fields and metadata).
If not present during the subscriptions.create call, it will default to the version of the Pub/Sub API used to make such call.
For example: `attributes { "x-goog-version": "v1" }`

inputs.name: subRetainAcked
inputs.label: Retain acked messages
inputs.helpMarkDown: Indicates whether to retain acknowledged messages. If true, then messages are not expunged from the subscription's backlog, even if they are acknowledged, until they fall out of the messageRetentionDuration window. This must be true if you would like to [subscriptions.seek to a timestamp](https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/replay-overview#seek_to_a_time).

inputs.name: subMessageRetentionDuration
inputs.label: Message retention duration (10m-7d)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
How long to retain unacknowledged messages in the subscription's backlog, from the moment a message is published. If retainAckedMessages is true, then this also configures the retention of acknowledged messages, and thus configures how far back in time a `subscriptions.seek` can be done.
Defaults to 7 days. Cannot be more than 7 days or less than 10 minutes.

inputs.name: subExpires
inputs.label: Expire this subscription after inactivity
inputs.helpMarkDown: A policy that specifies the conditions for this subscription's expiration. A subscription is considered active as long as any connected subscriber is successfully consuming messages from the subscription or is issuing operations on the subscription. If expirationPolicy is not set, a default policy with ttl of **31 days** will be used.

inputs.name: subExpirationTtl
inputs.label: Subscription expiration TTL (in days)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specifies the time-to-live duration for an associated resource. The resource expires if it is not active for a period of ttl. A duration in seconds with up to nine fractional digits, terminated by `s`. Example: `3.5s.`
The minimum allowed value for expirationPolicy.ttl is 1 day.

inputs.name: subDeadLetter
inputs.label: Enable
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A policy that specifies the conditions for dead lettering messages in this subscription.
The Cloud Pub/Sub service account associated with this subscriptions's parent project (i.e., `service-{project_number}@gcp-sa-pubsub.iam.gserviceaccount.com`) must have permission to `subscriptions.acknowledge()` messages on this subscription.

inputs.name: subDeadLetterTopic
inputs.label: Dead Letter Topic
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The name of the topic to which dead letter messages should be published. Format is `projects/{project}/topics/{topic}`.The Cloud Pub/Sub service account associated with the enclosing subscription's parent project (i.e., `service-{project_number}@gcp-sa-pubsub.iam.gserviceaccount.com`) must have permission to `topics.publish()` to this topic.
The operation will fail if the topic does not exist.
Users should ensure that there is a subscription attached to this topic since messages published to a topic with no subscriptions are lost.

inputs.name: subDeadLetterAttempts
inputs.label: Max Delivery Attemps
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The maximum number of delivery attempts for any message. The value must be between 5 and 100.
The number of delivery attempts is defined as 1 + (the sum of number of NACKs and number of times the acknowledgement deadline has been exceeded for the message).
A NACK is any call to subscriptions.modifyAckDeadline with a 0 deadline. Note that client libraries may automatically extend ack_deadlines.
This field will be honored on a best effort basis.

inputs.name: subRetryMinBackoff
inputs.label: Minimum Backoff (seconds)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A policy that specifies how Cloud Pub/Sub retries message delivery.
Value should be between 0 and 600 seconds.
[Learn more](https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/reference/rest/v1/projects.subscriptions#retrypolicy)

inputs.name: subRetryMaxBackoff
inputs.label: Maximum Backoff (seconds)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Value should be between 0 and 600 seconds.

inputs.name: subMaxMessages
inputs.label: Maximum number of messages to return

OutputVariables.name: PubSubTopic
OutputVariables.description: Topic name in the format: projects/{project}/topics/{topic}

OutputVariables.name: SubscriptionName
OutputVariables.description: The subscription name in the format: projects/{project}/subscriptions/{subscription}

OutputVariables.name: PubSubMessages
OutputVariables.description: List of messages in JSON format when use 'Get messages' operation
